result.execSummary:
The defendant Bridgette M. Messa was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In the event probation is revoked, Defendant would be entitled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges.
Concurrent with: Waushara Co Case No. 2015CF000011

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.  Defendant is prohibited from having any contact whatsoever with S. Gumz.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bridgette M. Messa

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

15CF-11 and 15CF-93 - Both Cases Called @ 1:38 PM:  Defendant Bridgette M. Messa in court, in custody, with attorney Caroline Ann Carver, both appearing in person.  Scott Blader appearing for the State of Wisconsin. Global resolution recited by DA w/argued terms on sentencing.  Def and counsel concur w/State's recital.  15CF-93:  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Terms of bifurcated SEH explained.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Meds serving no impairment on proceeding today.   Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained.  Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  15CF-11 - Plea to Ct 1 of INFO - Plea:  NC.  Court accepts State's motion to amend as to 15CF-93 contrary to s. 940.19(1)(a) (Simple Battery) Plea:  NC  Court accepts pleas and enters JOC as to both counts.  Argument by DA.  John Messa (uncle) makes statement to the Court on Def's behalf.  Argument by Atty Carver - argues for lesser conditional time and supervision.  Further argument by DA.  Statement by Def:  Yes.  The Court:   15CF-93: 6 mos WCJ - I/S - No TS Credit, Huber and GT.  S/W - 1 yr probation. Conditions:  Complete AODA and any follow thru, the defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician, N/C w/S. Gumz.  Court Costs - 60 DTP or PP.  15CF-11:  S/W - 4 yrs probation.  Conditions:  335 days WCJ - 182 days TS credit, Huber, No GT credit, Release should be on Xmas Eve, 153 days left to serve; AODA and any follow thru;  the defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician, any other terms as deemed appropriate by agent, including gainful employment; Costs of case, 15CF-93 DNA sample to be provided and expungement of DNA process explained thru DOJ; $2035 Undercover purchase money - joint/several w/co-defendants involved; no contact with A. Hopp, R. Van and/or S. Knaup.  Appeal Rights Given.
from DA Blader Re: Victim Compliance for 7/24/2015 Hearing
